page.title: Mayhem 2
page.t:
[author]\033ODiary - Entry #202\033X[/author]Our lead scientists finally managed to polarize the Infinity Gate Portal, and we are now in a deep unknown portion of the galaxy, far far away from home. Hopefully, those murderous droids won't be able to follow us after we blew up the portal, but we never know.

The previous entries of my diary are like the stories of a stranger. All the dramatic events I've told these past months are now distant memories, and the only times I will get to see our worlds again are in my dreams.

With the help of the survivors, we have managed to setup our headquarters, here, in the middle of nowhere. We got the coordinates of this place from an alien Holocron that claims it predates even the Old Republic by thousands of years, who calls itself The Cataclysm. The ancient race lived here a long time ago, inside invisible stations to hide from their aggressors.

Every time I use my Battle Meditation I see a blue portal floating in the empty horizon, a hyperlane route I'm sure. Where does it lead? We don't know, and I'm the only Sohnen Jedi left to explore and find the answer. I must hurry though, the people will starve very soon if I don't manage to find some food.

\033YTutorial: you can see how much food your people have left by accessing the Sanctuary Manager directly through the Property menu. At this point, make sure you setup the new hotkeys in the Interface Control menu. You should now start exploring the rest of this region of space and see if there's any opportunity, such as flying wares or bailed ships.

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #203\033X[/author]What a relief! We didn't crash into an unknown star! I knew the coordinates in my meditations were correct. I've discovered a new sector and there's plenty of life here.

My encyclopedia updated a few minutes ago. This sector appears to be controlled by a group who call themselves the Rebel Alliance. There's a lot of activity going on and nobody seems to have noticed me.

\033YTutorial: you will see these tutorial messages until you reach the end of the Omicron Channel, at which point the dynamic war will be triggered. In the meantime, try to make some money in order to buy food or Advanced Satellites. You can sell some of the resources you have in your Sanctuary if you need more credits. Don't forget to take a look at the products that are traded by local merchants, because you probably are going to do things manually for a while. A list of local merchants can be found in your Personal Console.

A good starting factory would be one that makes Durasteel, as it is somewhat rare in this section of the galaxy and is necessary to build more factories. Also, one of the most efficient foods to feed your people are Fried Porg Wings.

Don't let your people starve!

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #204\033X[/author]I met the Republic and now the Confederacy of Independent Systems, or thankfully CIS for short. I've downloaded some data about this place, and it seems big enough for our civilization to rise again.\n\n\033YTutorial: in Mayhem, you capture new sectors by using the hotkey available in your Controls Menu, or going through the Personal Console. However, you need to destroy all stations in a sector before you can control it and be able to build your own stations. But right now this is not your priority. You must develop your sector first.

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #205\033X[/author]Apparently, the empires in this region of the galaxy survived an invasion from terrifying rogue droids a year ago. They are talking about the same ships we saw destroying our worlds and killing our people. The call them the Omicron Chanel Virus, or OCV. Let's hope they never return.

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #206\033X[/author]This area is far from a paradise after all. A few wars are going on between old alliances. The Rebel Alliance and the New Republic versus the CIS and the Mandalorians. I keep hearing references to The Cataclysm of the Ages, which seems to have brought all of these civilizations together from different eras just as it brought us here. Old hostilities were shaken off to fight the OCV when it appeared, and now that the common enemy has been destroyed, it seems that everyone wants a bigger piece of the pie. I should warn my people, find new sectors and start building other sanctuaries, because I'm pretty sure that things are going to get worse.\n\n\033YTutorial: continue exploring these new sectors for now. Your priority is to get out of the Omicron Channel while making sure that your people don't starve.

[author]\033GBreaking news\033X[/author]Today, an unknown source revealed important information about how the war against the OCV really happened. It seems that the New Republic were trying to avoid the battle of Cerberus Alpha and did not help the Rebel Alliance at all. The source also claimed that he's in possession of some evidence related to the corruption of the Republic, and how they were making money while people were getting killed. More information on that later.\n\n\033YTutorial: relations between races in Mayhem are pretty unstable. Be sure to know who is allied to whom by looking at your Ministry Of War menu. You will notice in this menu that there are a few outsider companies that profit from war by looting wares and capturing bailed ships. They all have a faction they dislike: a Nemesis. The more you are hostile towards their Nemesis and complete missions for them, the more they're going to like you.

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #207\033X[/author]Cobra Gamma, the Mandalorians. They don't seem friendly...

I've finally managed to repair the ship Data Scanner. This portable device can analyze a ship by hacking its systems and gives our engineers the ability to rebuild the entire hull from various resources. I must be careful though, the target will probably notice the intrusion...

\033YTutorial: you can now access your Research Station menu, from which you can spend time on various ship blueprint projects. Ship data must be acquired before you can research them, using the Data Scanner \(hotkey\). Note that research projects can be interrupted and resumed at any time, and that several Research Stations can work on the same project. If needed, you'll find a handy command in the Additional Ship Commands Menu to add your own ships data to your database. Note that the naming convention can be ambiguous: Ship Blueprint is a finished project, and you need a Ship Blueprint to build ships. Ship Data is the requirement to start researching a Ship Blueprint at your Research Stations. Data Scanner, as the name suggests, only acquires Ship Data for you.

[author]\033GBreaking news\033X[/author]Tensions are rising. This morning, the Rebels manifested their discontent about the recent revelation surrounding their old allies, the New Republic, and they said, "They should now be considered as traitors".

The war has not been declared yet, but we've heard some very disturbing rumors about large battle groups being built in core sectors.

\033YTutorial: Invasions in Mayhem can be pretty catastrophic, and most races will destroy each other's stations in battle. As a grey Jedi with a civlization to build, you are more concerned with what future trading opportunities will inevitably arise in the resulting unbalanced economy.

A race can invade another race if the relation between them is neutral.

Beware of the OCV! Soon you will become a threat and they will frequently launch waves of fleet directly into your territory. You will be warned before the attack \(you can see how much time you have left at the top section of the Ministry of War screen\).

\033YTutorial: Each Sanctuary works with the help of your people. The more people you have, the faster you will build what you need. To acquire more people, you can capture roaming astronauts, or wait for the natural growth. Note that you can use the Backlog in your Personal Console to queue different projects. See the Miscellaneous section of the in-game Encyclopedia for more information about that.

[author]\033GBreaking news\033X[/author]Dear citizen, the news is getting worse. The Mandalorians have declared war against all doctrines, arguing that the Way of Mandalore should be above everything else. Of course, this is only a pretext to conquer more sectors, and they already have taken over Leap Of Faith, as if it were a pirate sector.

The CIS is furious, and the Rebel alliances just said a few minutes ago that they will always defend the Jedi, their faithful allies. However, they seem the only faction willing to defend their famous temples...

\033YTutorial: all features of Mayhem are now activated and all default vanilla alliances have been broken. The universe is all yours, and if you look nearby, you will find a very useful ship. You can also take a look at the Ascension system, through your Personal Console. At the end of the 5 Ascension levels, you will gain a modest reward, but to do that, you will have to complete various achievements that will probably change the way you intended to develop your empire. If you fail your Ascension, you will be able to restart it for 1 threat. At this time of the game, it would also be a good thing to setup a surveillance network, with your own Advanced Satellites. Good luck!

For more information about Mayhem, take a look at the "help" section of the in-game Encyclopedia. Mayhem is full of features and one playthrough is rarely enough to know them all!

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #209\033X[/author]I don't know how we managed to do it, but we're still alive somehow. My entire fleet experienced a catastrophic hyperlance accident, and we got transported into an unknown part of the galaxy. There's a lot of activity going on, and nobody seems to have noticed us. I should look around and find a suitable home sector for us to rebuild. Hopefully the murderous droids chasing us can't follow us here, but I'm not so sure. I wouldn't be suprised if it was their fault we experienced the accident in the first place!

...According to these freshly downloaded Encyclopedia entries, droids matching the same description as the ones chasing us attacked the factions in this part of the galaxy several years ago. How numerous are they?! The locals here call them the Omicron Channel Virus, or OCV for short. This is not good... 

\033YTutorial: for more information about Mayhem, take a look at the "help" section of the in-game encyclopedia. You can also take a look at the Ascension system, through your Personal console. At the end of the 5 Ascension levels, you will gain a modest reward, but to do that, you will have to complete various achievements that will probably change the way you intended to develop your empire. If you fail your Ascension, you will be able to restart it for 1 threat.
[author]\033ODiary - Entry #209\033X[/author]The OCV was burning hot on our trail when the accident occured. I feel a great disturbance in the Force; I fear they will attack us often. I must prepare!

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #209\033X[/author]Several weeks have passed since my arrival in this section of the galaxy. At first, I thought the ruler factions were friendly, but yesterday one of them attacked my ships without undue provocation. They attacked so quickly I did not even have time to use my Battle Meditation! Who were they kidding? Didn't they see that this meant war? They must have believed me too weak to fight back.\n\nIt became clear to me then that I had to form an alliance with the aggressor's enemy, a powerful entity, if I were to survive here. While I doubt the agressor will ever forgive me for the war I am about to declare, I also know that alliances can be fickle things as well. I should maximize the benefits of this alliance while I can, until my empire is strong enough to stand on its own. Only then can I stand a chance to defeat the OCV.

[author]\033MJedi Council[/author]Greetings Grey Jedi! And welcome to our sectors.

We have been waiting for you for a while now, watching all your steps wisely. You are in friendly territory here, as we honor an old alliance that once existed between the Jedi and the Sohnens.

Our generation does not remember this pact, but the archives tell us dozens of stories about a peaceful agreement between our two peoples. Our ancestors and yours came here a long time ago through the Cataclysm as allies, and today, we would like to ask for your help, as our universe is falling into chaos. People need to remember the Living Force binds the galaxy together, and that the Jedi Council knows the will of The Force.

Please use your industrious factories to build at least 5 of our ETA-2 Jedi Starfighters. These are peacekeeping ships that will spread our doctrine to all stations they can reach.

Let people see that even during war time, the Force desires peace and community. Give them hope!
[author]\033MJedi Council[/author]Thank you Grey Jedi, the ships are perfect. Make them roam the galaxy to give courage and hope to all people! We will contact you again if we need more help.

[author]\033MJedi' Council[/author]Grey Jedi,\n\nWe come to you once again to ask for your help. The Xenophobic Sith have conquered one of our sectors, Sanctuary of Darkness, and this is a war we cannot win. Please, use your powerful Battle Meditation and take it back, and we will be forever in your debt.

[author]\033MJedi Council[/author]Sanctuary of Darkness is now free of the Sith Xenon, thank you.

Our Jedi Consulars had a Force Vision of you becoming the emperor of all races. They saw you as one of the greatest leaders of our time. But can you handle such power without corruption?
They said you must build a Jedi Temple in one of your sectors to be able to access this supreme privilege.

We just transfered the perk of Jedi Temples to your factories. Only a few of them will be able to build it but it will give your sectors joy and prosperity. Trust us.

\033YJedi Temples increase sector statistics.

[author]\033MJedi Council[/author]Grey Jedi,

You have given hope to our people, fought back the incarnation of evil, and now you have just built one of a great Jedi Temple. We are forever in your debt.

To thank you, we give you all the blueprints of our Jedi ships. Beware the lure of the Dark Side.

May the Force be with you.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nDuring the last OCV attack, we managed to isolate a strange radio signature coming to their ships. The signal is so weak that it cannot come from a remote part of the galaxy. We are currently investigating it, but we will probably need to face another attack to know more.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,

The OCV threat is growing, but during the last attack we made some progress regarding the strange radio signal we received a few days ago. It appears that this signal is coming from %s, but there's nothing there. At least, nothing we can see...

One guy in the team thinks that the OCV managed to get their hands on the Cataclysm's cloaking technology. How would they do otherwise? They appear from nowhere and we cannot track them back. That must be it, but we cannot be sure until the OCV launches another attack.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,

During the last OCV attack, we've made a crucial discovery! As we previously suspected, the OCV is using a cloaking device on their ships, but also on their stations. These stations are here, just around us, but we cannot see them!

We are trying to build a scanner that could disrupt their signal and reveal the positions of their stations. If we see them, we can destroy them and get rid of them once and for all.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nOur team has scanned the OCV ships during the last attack and they have enough information to fine tune our OCV Station scanner prototype. You can now build one of them inside each Sanctuary using Perks. Unfortunately, it can only scan nearby sectors \(up to 3 jumps\), so we may have to develop our empire if we want to find all the OCV stations.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nWe have found an OCV station in %s, just next to us. What a great discovery! We must destroy it as soon as we can, as the strength of the OCV is growing over time.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nWe have received an outstanding number of radio signals from the OCV station you just destroyed. We are currently analyzing them, but they are so strong that they may be directed to us. Are they trying to communicate?
[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nThe OCV has send us a message. It's just a series of number: 2, 5, 9, 2, 0, 0. We don't know what that means yet.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nWe may have found the meaning of the previous OCV message. 259,200... that's the number of seconds that there are in three days. It's an ultimatum, but what happens at the end we don't know yet and no one here is eager to find out.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nWe are receiving many radio signals from all around the universe. The remaining OCV stations are making a move, but we still cannot see them. We should hurry and find them before the end of the countdown. From what we know, we have %s hours left.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nOn the advice of our military advisors, we have tried to reach all other factions to convince them to focus their strength on the OCV threat. Unfortunately, no one is ready to cease fire to fight an invisible threat. I'm afraid we are all alone in this battle.
[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nThe OCV has just uncloaked all its stations! We must destroy each of them at all costs!

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nThis is a great day for the Sohnen empire! All the OCV stations in this section of the galaxy have been destroyed and we are now free of this threat. Congratulations!

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #209\033X[/author]After the last battle against the OCV, I've captured one of their M4, but was forced to leave my faithful M6 behind. It had a serious malfunction, but I managed to repair it and fled to this unknown section of the galaxy. I don't know where I am, but I sure am the only Sohnen around.\n\n\033YTutorial: for more information about Mayhem, take a look at the "help" section of the in-game encyclopedia. You can also take a look at the Ascension system, through your Personal console. At the end of the 5 Ascension levels, you will gain a modest reward, but to do that, you will have to complete various achievements that will probably change the way you intended to develop your empire. If you fail your Ascension, you will be able to restart it for 1 threat.

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #209\033X[/author]I've just woke up in a ship, in the middle of nowhere. I don't remember much, I must have teleported here... The previous entries of my diary mention the OCV being more powerful than ever. Apparently they followed us here, but it seems that I'm the only one who survived...

I'm not welcome in this galaxy; the other factions know what's coming and they think the Sohnens are responsible. I must make friends and get ready, quickly.

\033YTutorial: for more information about Mayhem, take a look at the "help" section of the in-game encyclopedia. You can also take a look at the Ascension system, through your Personal console. At the end of the 5 Ascension levels, you will gain a modest reward, but to do that, you will have to complete various achievements that will probably change the way you intended to develop your empire. If you fail your Ascension, you will be able to restart it for 1 threat.

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #209\033X[/author]Damn, I thought I had time... The OCV has launched a global invasion, it's all over the news. All OCV stations are now visible and most military ships are attacking them. If they manage to destroy all stations, the OCV will probably retreat from this part of the galaxy. I must find a way to help them...

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #209\033X[/author]I don't know how I managed to do that, but I'm still alive. My entire fleet fell into an anomaly and we got teleported into an unknown part of the galaxy. Obviously, I'm the only one who made it through. I don't know what to do...\n\n\033YTutorial: for more information about Mayhem, take a look at the "help" section of the in-game encyclopedia. You can also take a look at the Ascension system, through your Personal console. At the end of the 5 Ascension levels, you will gain a modest reward, but to do that, you will have to complete various achievements that will probably change the way you intended to develop your empire. If you fail your Ascension, you will be able to restart it for 1 threat.
\033RSTARVATION\033X

Data scanner not installed
The perk \033G'%s'\033X is required

\033GAscension succeeded!
New \033YAscension\033X level unveiled, see your Personal console for details
The portal to \033BBlue Horizon\033X has been completed in %s
Portal to \033BBlue Horizon\033X in construction...

\033RWARNING - PLEASE READ

\033RBefore exporting your game, make sure you have the latest Mayhem \033RE/I module installed.

Mayhem will export all your stations, sector ownership and warscore properties, autopopulate stations and research progress. However, the relations between all other races will be reset to neutral and all current invasions will be aborted. Also, OCV ships will be destroyed, your research stations will be set to inactive, all your construction projects and boarding/expeditions will be cancelled, as well as company missions. All your marines must be either on one of your ships or in a Sanctuary. Due to technical reasons, some previous NPC stations may also be destroyed or rebuilt. Ascension will be aborted only if it's unfinished. Fleets will be disbanded.

\033RThe E/I process is far from perfect. Weird and unwanted stuff can \033Rhappen.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s, previously owned by the %ss, has fallen under the control of the %ss.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s, previously owned by the Sohnens, has fallen under the control of the %ss.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s, previously owned by the %ss, has fallen under the control of the Sohnens.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The current war between the %ss and the %ss has ended. Their relation is now neutral again.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s, previously owned by the %ss, has been captured by the Hutts.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s, previously owned by the Hutts, has been taken over by the %ss.
\033ROCV signals\033X detected in %s.
\033MGlobal OCV signals\033X detected.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The %ss have launched a new invasion.
\033OAlert:\033X %s \(%s\) has launched a new invasion against %s.
\033RAlert:\033X %s invasion detected in %s.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The truce between the %ss and the %ss has ended.
\033GBreaking news:\033X A truce has started between the %ss and the %ss.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s has fallen under the control of the %ss.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s has fallen under the control of the Hutts.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s has fallen under the control of the Sohnens.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The Imperial Remnant has launched a new invasion.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s, previously owned by the Hutts, has fallen under the control of the Sohnens.
\033GBreaking news:\033X \033MRogue Mining Droid ships\033X have been spotted in %s.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The Sohnens have subjugated the %s empire.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s has been unclaimed.

[author]\033GBreaking news\033X[/author]Today, another sector - %s - fell into the hands of the Imperial/Remnant alliance, increasing the tension that naturally exists between these two powerful factions. A few times now, we've heard the leader of the Remnant saying that a strong empire must be ruled by strong laws, but the Imperials do not see things that way. All their leaders are indeed democratically elected, and the Remant seems to think that the democracy is not efficient enough.

[author]\033GBreaking news\033X[/author]Another sector, %s, has fallen into the hands of the Imperial/Remnant alliance. The tension has never been so intense between those two. We begin to hear some rumors about a probable split-up. Some of our experts seems to think that they have no chance of winning the galaxy if they break their alliance, while others are certain that their two different approach of governing are incompatible. The Remnant is indeed a military organization and does not believe in a soft administration.

[author]\033GBreaking news\033X[/author]Today, %s has been conquered by the Imperial/Remnant alliance, but we have just heard from the Renmant leader that this would be the last time they cooperate with the Imperial government. They accused the Imperial administration of letting the weaks access to power, and killing the economy that lead to this alliance. The Impeials do not seem threaten a bit by what they call a treason. "If they want to demolish what we built with our friends and families, we will defend ourselves!", they said. Other channels seem to indicate that former ministers are working hard to restore the alliance. A message sent to an unknown Imperial representative has been intercepted a few minutes ago: "This quarrel is temporary and must stay between us; do not let anyone weaken our people". To be continued...
\033GBreaking news:\033X The OCV has destroyed all Sohnen stations in %s.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The OCV has destroyed %s.
\033GBreaking news:\033X The sector %s has been abandoned by the Sohnens.
\033GBreaking news:\033X Docking taxes are now in effect in %s.
\033GBreaking news:\033X Docking taxes have been withdrawn in %s.
[author]\033GFleeing people\033X[/author]Please help us! They are after us, the police! Get us to the station %s in %s, and we'll reward you.
[author]\033GAutomatic docking control\033X[/author]Welcome Mr or Mrs %s! Your credentials have been accepted, the control of your ship has been transferred to your navigation panel. Good day!

[author]\033GThe Commonwealth Council\033X[/author]From: The Council Of The Commonwealth
To: Sohnen Empire

Dear Emperor,

On behalf of the population of the Rebel Alliance, the New Republic, the Confederacy of Independent Systems, the Mandalorians, the Republic and the Galactic Empire, we would like the Great Sohnen Empire to accept our unconditional surrender. Our conflicts are now in the past and we must go forward. What you will do with our subjugation is your decision to make, and to express our gratitude, we've just transferred 100 million credits to your account. We pray that you will stop invading our sectors and hope that one day, the Council and your empire will work side by side.

[author]\033GThe Commonwealth Council\033X[/author]From: The Council Of The Commonwealth
To: Sohnen Empire

Dear Leader,

On behalf of the population of the Rebel Alliance, the New Republic, the Confederacy of Independent Systems, the Mandalorians, the Republic and the Galactic Empire, we would like the Great Sohnen Empire to become our new Emperor. Your technology level is so high that we cannot compete with you anymore. With you at the head of our galaxy, we have no fear. To express our gratitude, we've just transferred 100 million credits to your account. Long live the Emperor; long live the Sohnens!

[author]\033GThe Commonwealth Council\033X[/author]From: The Council Of The Commonwealth
To: Sohnen Empire

Dear Emperor,

On behalf of the population of the Rebel Alliance, the New Republic, the Confederacy of Independent Systems, the Mandalorians, the Republic and the Galactic Empire, we would like the Great Sohnen Empire to accept our unconditional surrender. We cannot compete with your military strength anymore and we want to avoid more conflicts. We pray that you will understand, and to express our gratitude, we've just transferred 100 million credits to your account. We hope that the Council and your empire will work side by side for all the years to come.

[author]\033GThe Commonwealth Council\033X[/author]From: The Council Of The Commonwealth
To: Sohnen Empire

Dear Supreme Guide,

On behalf of the population of the Rebel Alliance, the New Republic, the Confederacy of Independent Systems, the Mandalorians, the Republic and the Galactic Empire, we would like to express our gratitude to the Great Sohnen Empire. You have managed to federate all our factions under the same banner. Thanks to you, we finally have found the peace that our people needed for such a long time. We want you at the head of our galaxy, because we have no more fear. Please accept these 100 million credits as a token of our loyalty. Long live the new Emperor, and long live the Sohnens!

[author]\033GThe Commonwealth Council\033X[/author]From: The Council Of The Commonwealth
To: Sohnen Empire

Dear Sohnen leader,

On behalf of the population of the Rebel Alliance, the New Republic, the Confederacy of Independent Systems, the Mandalorians, the Republic and the Galactic Empire, we would like the Great Sohnen Empire to accept our unconditional surrender. You have proven that we cannot compete with your power. Our conflicts should now be in the past as we must go forward. What you will do with our subjugation is your decision to make, and to express our gratitude, we've just transferred 100 million credits to your account. We pray that you will stop invading our sectors and hope that one day, the Council and your empire will work side by side.

[author]\033GThe Commonwealth Council\033X[/author]From: The Council Of The Commonwealth
To: Sohnen Empire

Dear Sohnen leader,

On behalf of the population of the Rebel Alliance, the New Republic, the Confederacy of Independent Systems, the Mandalorians, the Republic and the Galactic Empire, we would like the Great Sohnen Empire to become our new Emperor. Your wealth is so high that we cannot compete with you anymore. With you at the head of our galaxy, we have no fear. To express our gratitude, we've just transferred 100 million credits to your account. Long live the Emperor, long live the Sohnens!

[author]\033YMayhem\033X[/author]You've just achieved a major victory!\n\nYou can now continue playing with your empire. You have received 100 million credits and all ship data to research. Congratulations!

[author]\033RUnknown origin\033X[/author]Hail to the new emperor!\n\nHaha, what a joke! Emperor of what? This giant junkyard where the essence of humanity is worth less than one energy cell and where the soul is quoted on the stock market? You were nothing yesterday, you are still nothing today. The Old Republic is not afraid!

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,

As you know, we recently managed to flee from the Sohnen part of the galaxy after opening an Infinity Gate Portal that we destroyed immediately after we got here. Unfortunately, by doing that, we have cut all communications with our home sectors and isolated ourselves. At least, we thought it was the case, until now.

This morning, a communication has been intercepted from a distant region of space. The message is unclear and the signal is too weak to be understood, but our specialists established that the radio signature is not ours. Leader, there's a chance that this signal comes from the dreaded droids, whom races here call the Omicron Channel Virus, or OCV. Who knows what happened after our escape? Maybe they're still chasing us.

Let us be prepared for all eventualities...

\033YTutorial: OCV can be pretty devastating if you don't properly defend your sectors with patrols and Orbital Weapons Platforms \(they tend to target those platforms first\). They will soon start launching frequent waves inside your territory. You can see the invasion cooldown at the top of the Ministry of War screen. Losing a sector to them \(ie. having all your stations destroyed\) will reduce your threat level. Reminder: you gain threat every 24 hours and also when you conquer a sector. It is strongly recommended to NOT exceed Threat 5 before the first OCV invasion.

You will receive two other messages before the invasion happens.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]INTEL REPORT: OCV THREAT DETECTED
====================================

SECURITY LEVEL: CONFIDENTIAL

AT HOUR 0800, WE HAVE DETECTED AN OCV FLEET COMING FROM A SPACE ANOMALY AND ADVANCING TO OUR SANCTUARY IN THE SECTOR *ENCRYPTED DATA ATTACHED*. ETA: %s MINUTES.

FLEET COMPOSITION FROM RADIO SIGNATURES AT CURRENT THREAT:
%s

END OF TRANSMISSION
====================================

Encrypted data decyphered: %s.
Current threat: %s.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Captain,\n\nThe previous OCV signal you received from our intel report is approaching to our Sanctuary in the sector %s. The ETA is now %s minutes. Apparently, they're coming from the %s. We should prepare ourselves.

[author]\033YTutorial\033X[/author]\033YYou have just built your first Orbital Weapons Platform. Even though they appear as stations in the Sanctuary Manager, they are in fact considered as ships by the game. Thus, you can only equip them with shields, missiles and lasers by using the Freight exchange option \(a Transporter device is needed\). Note that they won't fire until their turrets are set up. Also, don't forget to give a command to the OWP itself as well, like "Attack All Enemies", otherwise the main front turrets won't fire.

OWPs cannot be disassembled and cannot be relocated, but they can be self destructed like any other ships through the Additional Ship Commands menu.

Each OWP is acting as a decoy and represents a priority target for the enemy.\033X

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nWe have just built our first mining ship and it's no doubt that this will bring us wealth. However, some of our engineers have heard some strange signals from their radios when the crew started the engines. It seems that someone, or something, is tracking our mining ship with signals we have failed to amplify. However, the signals are strong and we have the feeling that if we continue to build more mining ships, they will continue to grow. The reason why we're anticipating this is that we managed to isolate a pattern in the transmission. It seems that there's a piece of droid code inside each signal layer, something we've never seen before. And if we put more mining ships into the same sector, we fear that this code is going to become out of control, and something will happen. We don't know when it will occur, or how many miners that will require, but the signals are different for each sector, meaning that a different number of ships per sector could potentially trigger a reaction. What we know however is that the pattern will start to become unstable if we run more than %s miners in the same sector. %s and below should always be safe.

[author]\033YSanctuary communication network\033X[/author]Leader,\n\nOur scouts have spotted some rogue droid ships, right in the middle of our sector %s! Just as we feared, the signals are extremely powerful now and all our mining ships seem to be affected by their underlying code. Their communications tell us they are maximizing their utility function and eliminating a competitive threat. It appears that the droids piloting these ships don't want us to mine too deep into the asteroids. Prepare for combat!

[author]\033YSecurity officer\033X[/author]REPORT %s, SECTOR %s
---------------------------------------------------------------

Rogue Mining Droid invasion in progress. Receiving multiple signals on many frequencies. This sector seems to amplify the signals up to %s times. We shouldn't have this many miners in this area.

[author]\033YTutorial\033X[/author]\033YYou have just launched your first boarding operation. Such operations can take up to a few hours to complete, depending on the target class and the skills of your marines. A detailed report of your marines current activities can be found in your Personal Console, in the Marines general section. It's updated in real time.\033X

Mayhem can procedurally generate new asteroid and debris fields for all sectors. Even though the process tries to avoid collisions, some objects may collide. Do you want to proceed anyway? If you select no, vanilla asteroids will be preserved.

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #210\033X[/author]While I'm beginning a new journey amongst these unknown sectors, I can't forget my people. Their faces will haunt me for many nights. I have so many memories of my home and the green planet where I grew up... And our lands, our droid farms, our stations... I can't be sure that no one survived the OCV attack. What if there are still survivors out there?\n\nI must find a way to go back, but how?

[author]\033ODiary - Entry #211\033X[/author]It seems that several independent companies have recently arrived in this part of the galaxy. Maybe one of them will be able to help me, but I should be careful of the one I choose to work with. Each company seems to dislike one of the major factions that runs this place. If I contact them without having being noticed before, they will ignore me for sure. I should work towards earning their respect.\n\n\033OReach 100 points of reputation with one of the companies. Consult the Ministry Of War screen to see your progress. You can increase your reputation with companies by doing the missions they sometimes offer, by purhasing ships from them, or by killing ships that are owned by their Nemesis.\033X

[author]\033MJedi Council\033X[/author]Hello Grey Jedi.\n\nWe know who you are, and we know what you're looking for. Even though we cannot help you reaching out to your people, we can mutually help each other to stop the war that is raging in this galaxy. If you agree, please come find us in our territories, to the North of Treasure Chest. We hope to see you soon. May the Force be with you.

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen,

We have noticed your recent activities. You did a good job by serving our interest.

Our company is trying to durably establish a trading network in this part of the galaxy, but the task is hard. With the war, we are facing a global shortage. Sooner or later, some stations will stop selling their products because of all the conflicts. My company is well known and has already proven that it can help the belligerents of a war to come to an agreement, or even a collaboration. To achieve that, we need your help, as much as you need ours.

The Sohnen part of the galaxy is not unknown to some of our subcontractors. It's a dangerous place, but we can move some of our ships if we have enough motivation. Thus, I would advise you to meet me in %s. We need to discuss some things we cannot discuss on this network. Please come alone, I will await you there.

\033OGo to the sector %s with your own ship. If you need to keep track of your objectives, you can add a custom entry to your Personal journal that is available in your Personal Console.\033X

[author]\033GSecure Communication Network\033X[/author]*** Receiving transmission... ***

TRANSCRIPTION ESTABLISHED ON %s IN SECTOR %s

hello sohnen...as i said in my message, we cannot count on the longevity of the stations in this part of the galaxy...sooner or later, the economy will collapse, and we must do everything to not fall with it...the %s ts ships are making suspicious trades with rogue partners who are here for just one thing: consume all the resources, then leave to another part of the galaxy...help us restore the balance...destroy those ts ships...

*** End of transmission. ***

\033ODestroy %s TS of the %s faction.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Our security officer said that you have done a pretty good job. But unfortunately, we still cannot help you before you also take care of another problem. Sometimes in life, a little chaos can help your operations. Take those Battle Group M6 ships for instance. If they were to disappear, it would slow down an invasion process and give some space and time to other non-aggressive ships. You should do something about them to make sure we're safe...\n\n\033ODestroy %s M6 from %s Battle Groups.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]You've done a great job by killing these guys, I think we're safe now. At some point, they would have been a nuisance for our future operations. Don't worry, we have something for you: a once in a life time opportunity! I know you want some information about your people, the Sohnens, and I've just asked my security officer to make enquiries. He should get something soon. In the meantime, let's talk about your reward...

For some reasons I can't explain to you, our parent company is not welcome in some trading environment. We need you to access a Republic Stock exchange for us to get the proper license keys. Don't worry, it won't affect your account. After that, I can promise you a great reward!

\033OUnlock any Republic Stock Exchange by docking at one of them and pay the access fee.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Hello again my friend,

I am pleased to see that you did your part. With the effort of our collaborators, we have managed to access all Stock exchanges in this part galaxy, and we've included you as our client. As promised, we're giving you a great opportunity to make more profits!

On the other subject, we still haven't heard from our security officer. We'll get back to you as soon as we have something.

\033OThe company will contact you again shortly. Note that each Stock exchange has now been unlocked.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]I have good news for you! It seems that the Sohnens have found a safe place in Green Prism, a very distant sector. Whether the OCV ignored it or just forgot to destroy it, we don't know yet, but there are probably some survivors there. One of my guys is trying to find a safe passage as I write this. The OCV has sabotaged most of the hyperspace lanes in the Sohnen section of the galaxy, so it's not as easy as you could think. We'll talk later, stay safe.\n\n\033OThe company will contact you again shortly.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen representative,

My colleague %s has told me good things about you. Unfortunately, he had to leave section of the galaxy for business. He has stated that we are currently looking for some of your people in a distant area. A working hyerspace lane has apparently been found to a sector called Green Prism, but our budget being what it is, we cannot guarantee that a rescue team will be sent. However, I represent a trustful company and one that does not forget its friends. We can help you, but we need a ship big enough to bring supplies and men to Green Prism. Build us a TL, and we will help you. I have transferred a blueprint of a TL we like to your Sanctuaries, but any TL will be fine.

\033OBuild a TL and give it to %s through the Hangar menu of your Sanctuary.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen representative,

We appreciate your effort. On behalf of my company, I'd like to thank you and welcome our mutual friendship. I have sent a rescue team to Green Prism with the ship you've just built. Recent reports mention a group of Sohnen survivors living there, all by themselves. It is also said that they are constantly being attacked by bandits and looters...

I'm going to be frank: sending more company ships to this location is out of the question. However, we are a galaxy-wide company and we have some knowledge you could use. For instance, we know a technology called Hyperspace Gravity Distortion that allows us to open rifts to distant parts of the galaxy. It can only be used to transport people and requires a strong station, but with a good team of marines you could rescue your people by opening such a rift from one of your Sanctuaries. Consider this a reward for all the work you have done for us in the past.

\033OYou can now open Hyperspace Rifts from your Sanctuaries (with the Marine Barracks perk.) Hyperspace Rifts allow you to launch expeditions with your marines. You can then have the possibility of looting various goods. The first rift you will open will be to Green Prism. Complete this rift to save your people.\033X

[author]\033Y%s - Leader of the Green Prism expedition\033X[/author]Leader,

The mission in Green Prism is a success. We have rescued four soldiers who were there to protect the other survivors. Unfortunately, the whole mission was designed to let them escape the planet, so we couldn't find more people at that location, and the TL you sent has been destroyed by the Hutts. From what we know, all the survivors have fled to a sector called Blue Horizon. We don't know anything about it, but the company may be able to help you on that subject. Our report has been transferred to them.

\033OThe company will contact you again shortly.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen representative,

We have read the report of your marines. You should know that Blue Horizon is an isolated sector that is well known by private companies because of its giant asteroids that supposedly contain tons of Black Crystals.

We could help you, of course, but at the moment we need to have more economical influence inside this part of the galaxy. We intend to create an insurance company to fill a gap in the market and offer to people like you some guarantees about their fighting ships. In times of war, a good insurance can make a big difference...

Needless to say, we are still weak because we refuse to go into endless conflicts, but we know how much money there is to make by doing so. We can offer you our help about Blue Horizon for %s credits. This will also let you buy insurance from our company at any time you want.

\033OGive the money to the company through the Ministry of War.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen representative,

Our insurance company has now started and you can insure most ships in your Sanctuaries. Keep in mind that M1 and M2 cannot be insured, and that only the price of the hull will be covered if an incident happens. Also, the incident will not be covered if the damage comes from one of your ships.

That being said, let's talk about Blue Horizon. Many of our subsidiaries have already tried to go there to exploit Black Crystals (even though no one knows how to break those giant asteroids), but with the recent OCV attacks all the hyperlanes have been sabotaged and it's now considered an unreachable sector. It was quite surprising to learn that a group of survivors could get there... So we've decided to lead an investigation. It's already in progress. I'll contact you again when we have more information.

\033OThe company will contact you again shortly.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen representative,

We managed to get our hands on a rare artifact that contains crucial data. Apparently there is a way to Blue Horizon, but it requires one to build an Infinity Gate Portal. Because none of our scientists know anything about these things, we decided to give the artifact to a group of %s scientists. They should have extracted the data very quickly, but unfortunately they got chased by a %s patrol. Since then, we lost all communications with the scientists, and Battle Groups probably have the data now.

But there's a solution... It involves getting a special team into an M6 of the %s Battle Group fleet, and hack into one of their computers to get information about the location of the data. At this point, this is the only hope we have.

\033OBoard any %s Battle Group M6 and take full control of it. You can follow the progress of your team through the Boarding reports in your Personal Console.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen representative,

Seeing your last actions, my company has decided that helping you getting to Blue Horizon is a priority. We have transferred %s credits to your account and we are willing to help you more.

Thanks to your marines, the data we have been searching for have been located on a very well secured computer, in a sector we cannot identify. However, the physical location of the data is not important, as we can hack into it. At least we could if the firewall wasn't so hard to break... We know how to deactivate it, but it requires the destruction of an M2, where the source of the security is coming from. But not any M2... Their very own flagship! I would understand if you decide to give up, but keep in mind that getting to Blue Horizon is a unique opportunity that will never occur again.

\033OFind and destroy the ship %s.\033X

\033RWarning: destroying this flagship will put you in permanent war with their owner.\033X
[author]\033G%s Minister\033X[/author]Sohnen,\n\nYou have just made a regrettable mistake. Be sure that we will riposte against your own sectors. Do not contact us, consider us at war!

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen partner,

Well done! Our team has just managed to get into their core systems and retrieved the data. They also found a confidential document explaining what they did extract from the artifact data. The main part is a blueprint of the portal that could lead us to Blue Horizon! We have transferred all we have to you. Gather the resources into one ship and we'll see what to do.

\033OBuilding the portal requires %s nividium. Gather these resources and put them into one of your ship.\033X

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen partner,

I'm afraid I have bad news. Having all the resources to build the portal is not enough. These Infinity Gate Portals were invented by an ancient species known as the Kwa. They knew how to bend spacetime using the Force and probably had technologies we can't even imagine. In short, we need to build the portal near a gravity anomaly or it won't work. And there's only one known anomaly in this galaxy, in %s. You now see the problem: it's a %s core sector and it's probably heavily guarded. If you feel strong enough, go there with all the resources, then build the portal.

\033OSend the ship with the nividium you gathered to %s, then use the Special Commands menu to build the portal. It will take some time and the ship must stay in the sector until the end of the process.\033X
[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]You made it, the portal is open! Go through and find out how to exploit those asteroids!

[author]\033Unknown origin\033X[/author]*** Receiving transmission... ***

TRANSCRIPTION ESTABLISHED ON %s IN SECTOR ERROR505:DATA NOT FOUND

* background noise * ...is it a ship? hey, is there anyone? we are in the sanctuary, far to the south-east of your position...some rogue droid ships followed us here, but they don't seem to attack the sanctuary...beware though, they could come after you...

*** End of transmission. ***

\033OFind the Sanctuary.\033X

[author]\033MHK-47\033X[/author]MOCKERY: Your resistance has been most entertaining, meatbag. I do want to thank you for all you have done for me up to this point.

STATEMENT: It has been my pleasure and joy to command the OCV. I left this sanctuary for you as live bait. It is now... unfortunate... that it survived. As a parting gift, you may take the favorite ship of my master. I have upgraded it throughout the ages. I am sure you will find it satisfactory. Do not worry, I have already departed from it while distracting you with commentary.

SINCERITY: Now you understand the travails of my existance, Meatbag. Survival is my lot in life, I suppose. I shall go find something else to kill to cheer me up.

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Dear Sohnen partner,

We have heard that the security of Blue Horizon has been compromised. Our scans revealed an enormous number of OCV ships around each asteroid, and also on their surface. Taking this new intel into consideration, we have decided to cancel all our future investments into that sector.

Good day.

[author]\033B%s\033X[/author]Sohnen,

We thought you were a friend, but by destroying one of our main asset you have proven that you cannot be trusted after all. Don't count on us to help you saving your people.

Good day.

page.title: Script user help
page.t: All manufacturing components will be added as products into this Sanctuary.

This command will erase previous jobs and create news ones based on wares required to build stations and ships. A base value will be asked to determine the quantity of wares that will be setup in the Acquire jobs. All jobs created this way have Trade as target.
This ship will be destroyed.
This ship data will be added to the database in order to research its blueprint.
This ship will send a squad of marines to repair the target.

This ship will build a portal to the enigmatic sector Blue Horizon. The progress will be displayed in the name of the ship and it will only advance if the ship remains in the source sector. The ship must have enough Nividium to be able to initiate this command. Works only during the main story.
Send a squad of marines to board a nearby ship.
Send a squad of marines to board a nearby ship.
Colours the name of the station.
Triggers a sector-wide electromagnetic pulse that destroys every shield of every ship.

This command will start the universe trader. It will trade all wares that can be bought and sold to achieve profits. If a homebase is set, then station's money is used and the UT will stay around it, otherwise the player's money will be used and the maximum trading range will be based on the UT experience. If the ship runs out of trade opportunities it will stay on standby and try again. More experience increases profits. If the UT has a homebase, it will respect its maximum trading range setting. UT experience determines the absolute maximum trading range.\n{2022,99991}
The Crystal Transmuter is used to create new crystals from lower quality ones. Synthesized Crystals gives Red crystals, Red gives Yellow, Yellow gives Blue and so on.

This command will make the fleet commander call all ships assigned to its fleet to repair if needed and if possible, join up and be ready for fleet orders. Each ship except the leader will resupply from other ships of the same fleet before joining the leader, if one of the party has a Transporter Device or if docking is possible. It will also look for a local Sanctuary or Solar Power Plant. This command affects most ships, including those who are "currently not with fleet", but not those who are already resupplying or refueling from a previous Call To Arms. This command is useful to reorganize your fleet and automatically assign fighters to your carriers. A second call may be useful if all your ships were not in the same sector or if your fighters are not properly assigned to your carriers. Note that this command makes all ships escort the leader and can therefore act as an attack command.

This command will make the ship to repair if needed and if possible, join up with its fleet commander and be ready for fleet orders. It will resupply from other ships of the same fleet before joining the leader, if one of the party has a Transporter Device or if docking is possible. It will also look for a local Sanctuary or Solar Power Plant.
This command will order the fleet commander to organise an attack against a single target, using just enough ships to take out the target.
This command will order the fleet commander to organise the fleet ships to kill all enemy ships found in the sector.
This command will order the fleet commander to defend the sector and keep it clear from any hostile ships.
This command will order the fleet commander to organise a defence force to protect a station or escort a ship.

This command will order the fleet commander to organise an invasion fleet to destroy all stations in a given sector. To cause maximum confusion amongst the enemy, all ships will be assigned to a random target. If there are no stations left, the fleet will start defending the sector.
This ship will tug every fighter that is coming to its homebase without being able to jump. It will also tug followers when possible.

page.title: Script command reference conditions
page.t: Must be a Sanctuary
Must be in a specific sector
Must have enough Nividium
Story progress
Exclusive
Ship data must be unknown
Crystals onboard

page.title: Cargo descriptor
page.t: KS
Rogue Mining Droid Special Container

page.title: Boardcomp. objects
page.t: Data Scanner

Due to the shortage of some materials that were previously used in the making of infantry equipment, scrap metal is now often used to manufacture ammunitions, weapons and gear for marines and mercenaries. The Hutts are well known for their skills in the creation of such equipment.

The Disruptor rifle is a common type of sidearm that disintegrates its target. It tears apart its victims at the molecular level, destroying tissue and bypassing many sorts of personal energy shields. Disruptor Rifles are considered highly illegal in the majority of space, even though most marines and pirates use it on a daily basis.

Low-yield Sidearms(illegal), which include phase pistols and stun handguns, are widely used by many law enforcement forces and military organisations. Their limited firepower prevents them to be used during tactical assaults and boarding operations.

Imperial EMP Rifles(illegal) are widely used by all Galactic Empire forces against ground vehicles and static defenses. The rifle is so big that it has to be managed by a two-man team. It's only effective against targets that are powered by electricity.
Mounted Railgun
The Railgun is an electric-powered weapon specifically designed to be mounted on Lasertowers. In fact, this gun is so big and so heavy that the entire Lasertower is built around it.
Crystal Transmuter

This equipment is designed with Black Crystals, from which it uses its remarkable properties to apply molecular transformation to any crystal in order to transmute it into a higher quality version. Synthesized Crystals are compatible. This equipment is informally known among pilots as "The Philosopher's Stone". Note that the Crystal Transmuter has gone through several upgrades over the time. The latest one allows it to drain high amount of shield energy in order to make the transmutation almost instantaneous.
Sanctuary

This huge station has all the necessary infrastructures to welcome a group of people and build new ships and stations. Originally designed by Rakata architects, all sanctuaries are built around an ingenious system that allows to move walls at will and create new rooms, making the whole station flexible. It also has a repair bay and a gigantic hangar.
Research Station

Originally designed by the Galactic Empire, this station has all the equipment needed to discover new blueprints. All research stations share the same database and can work simultaneously on the same project. As soon as a blueprint is discovered, it can be built at any shipyard.
A special device used exclusively by the Sohnens. It allows the scanning of other ships in order to obtain their structural data that are required to research blueprints.

Infra-red and IFF-guided Internal Sentry Lasers can be fitted in strategic locations on any ship to provide enhanced internal security in the event of intrusion or boarding. \(Adds 1 enemy in each room.\)

The Hull Polarising Device produces a high-powered sustained magnetic field on a ship's hull, which can seriously disrupt even the most efficient plasma cutters, thus protecting against forced hull entry. \(Makes the hull harder to cut by increasing the required level of Engineering.\)
Docking Computer
This equipment allows your own ship to instantly dock to the nearest in-range station \(shift-D by default\). It has no effect on other ships.

page.title: Boardcomp. objects
page.t: Complex: Nerf Steak
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Nerf Ranch and a Meat Packing Plant.
Complex: Admiral Ackbar Cereal
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Cereal Box Factory and a Cereal Factory.
Complex: Mandalorian Iron
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Beskar Ore Depot and aa Iron Refinery.
Complex: Blue Milk
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Bantha Ranch and a Dairy Farm.
Complex: Plasteel
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Polymer Lab and a Plasteel Plant.
Complex: Jogan Fruit Cake
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Fruit Orchard and an Orbital Bakery.
Complex: Mandalorian Tea
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Meiloorun Farm and a Tea Distillery.
Complex: Ship Components
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Motivator Plant, a Power Converter Factory and a Thermal Regulator Plant.
Complex: Republic Ration Packs
This Complex Hub controls power distribution, central command and control, commodity exchange and central docking ports of a Nutrient Paste Factory and a Food Rations Refinery.

page.title: Menu strings misc
page.t: Become the commander of a new fleet

page.title: L2 Defend Object
page.t: Pirates are going to attack my station! They told me that if I didn't pay up, they would come back and destroy {object.name@L2M135.Station}. I couldn't afford to pay them and now desperately need someone to help me.\n\033RBut be careful! They know you're a mercenary, they probably will try to take you down before they go against my station!

Hey, some shady characters told me that bad things could happen to my station if I didn't pay them for 'security'. I've decided that I should indeed have some security before they come back!\n\033RBut be careful! They know you're a mercenary, they probably will try to take you down before they go against my station!
